turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: You and Charlie are taking the Jap home, tonight.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What...?  What if I say no?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Check your gun before you leave. They're not allowed in Japan.  It's a nice, safe country.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Why me?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: They said send a detective if I could spare one.  I can always spare you.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: It's not your job.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: He was my partner.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: They're blaming it on you.  Christ, Conklin, you didn't even tell me you lost the prisoner!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I planned on catching him, Captain.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: How?  You don't know the place.  You don't know the language.  Get on the plane.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: He killed a police officer.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Your plane's at nine a.m.  Be on it. That's orders.  Period.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: ... Remember, counterfeiting is the Feds.  They'll be all over Abolofia's place.  Stick tight. You I.D. the other plate, he does real time.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: OHASHI
turns.text: You lost a man we wanted for some time.  It was very incompetent on your part, officer.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Incompetent is letting people waltz through a secure area wearing your uniforms, carrying official documents.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I want a gun.

turns.speaker: OHASHI
turns.text: It is not allowed.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: We're police officers.

turns.speaker: OHASHI
turns.text: You're foreigners.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Work with me.  I want your best detective.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hey, inspector, I don't intend to take the rap for this.

turns.speaker: OHASHI
turns.text: Do you know what this is?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Could you fill me in?

turns.speaker: OHASHI
turns.text: Why don't you ask your chief detective?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Because I want you to tell me.

turns.speaker: OHASHI
turns.text: The young are eating the old, something that usually doesn't happen here.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Can we skip the poetry, inspector?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: OHASHI
turns.text: Your visa has expired.  Be on a plane in twenty-four hours or you will be deported.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: While you were hanging out at the visa office, we found the son-of-a- bitch.

turns.speaker: OHASHI
turns.text: Look.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hey...!  HEY, I'M TALKING TO YOU, INSPECTOR!

turns.speaker: OHASHI
turns.text: Twenty-four hours, detective.

turns.speaker: OHASHI
turns.text: Your plane leaves at six.  Two officers will escort you.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: For God's sake, Ohashi, I need your help.  Let me out of here!

turns.speaker: OHASHI
turns.text: You had my help, detective.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: If anything happens to her while I'm here --

turns.speaker: OHASHI
turns.text: -- Do you know where she is, detective?  Do you know how to find her?  Even where to start?  We will find them.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I have to get to Sugai.

turns.speaker: OHASHI
turns.text: Goodbye, officer.

turns.speaker: SUGAI
turns.text: Seven years work by the finest engraver.  Mass produced, sequentially numbered.  The best there has ever been, Mr. Conklin.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'm impressed.  But let's use the short form.  I'm looking for --

turns.speaker: SUGAI
turns.text: -- Kobo... I know.  He killed two of my partners.  One in New York, one at the printing plant.

turns.speaker: SUGAI
turns.text: I took Kobo from the street.  I gave him a home, a future... But my ways were too slow for him... I served seven years in prison for my boss when I was a young man.  Kobo wouldn't serve seven minutes for his Oyabun.  He was supposed to take over this syndicate when I retired.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I want him.

turns.speaker: SUGAI
turns.text: He'll be dealt with.

turns.speaker: SUGAI
turns.text: Our associates in New York were close to closing a deal with us.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: The families who control the casinos?

turns.speaker: SUGAI
turns.text: Yes.  Unlike our syndicates, your criminals don't understand the words 'honor' and 'duty'... We can't afford not to deal with them.

turns.speaker: SUGAI
turns.text: Imagine if your families could pay their gambling and drug debts with perfect counterfeit bought for cents on the dollar.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: The Feds would be onto you in a month.

turns.speaker: SUGAI
turns.text: Not with these bills.  And even if it only took them six months, do you know what our profit margin would be?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Why tell me this?

turns.speaker: SUGAI
turns.text: The other plate is currently in New York, in the hands of Kobo's man. Find it for me.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You trust me?

turns.speaker: SUGAI
turns.text: I'll pay you.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: With these?

turns.speaker: SUGAI
turns.text: Swiss bank deposit.  Gold bullion. Whatever you want.  You know the city and the police.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: If I say no?

turns.speaker: SUGAI
turns.text: You're smarter than Kobo.  You know the price of deceit.  Think about it.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I don't have to.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: SUGAI
turns.text: He'll find out you took me.  I'm unprotected.  He'll kill us.  All of us.  You don't stand a chance.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That wasn't our deal.

turns.speaker: SUGAI
turns.text: You want him dead too.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: After a court convicts him.  He belongs to me.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Can't thank you enough, Mr. Sebastian. If you hadn't come along...

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: We were worried to death.  It's awfully kind of you.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: We're not used to the big city. Where we come from it's not so easy to get lost.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: You certainly have a nice place here.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Well stocked.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: He knows what he's doing.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: If he won't cooperate?

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Mr. Sebastian is a host who wants to be appreciated.  We'll appreciate him and he'll cooperate.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: I'm sure glad you found us, Sebastian.  What do you think, Mary?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I don't think there is another human being in this whole world who would have helped us.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Pris?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Let's go while there is still time.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Anywhere.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: What's the point?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Not to be trapped.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: You underestimate the trap, Mary.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: One man.  He must be good.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Then go get him.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: That wouldn't be very sporting.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: The name is Batty.  Roy Batty.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Oh?

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Yeah.  It might be better if we talk in private, Sebastian.  Why don't you go home.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Here's your check, my boy.  Thank you.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: I'm surprised you didn't come to me sooner.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: It's not an easy thing to meet your maker.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: And what can he do for you?

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Can the maker repair what he makes?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Would you like to be modified?

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Had in mind something a little more radical.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: What's the problem?

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Death.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: I'm afraid that's a little out of my...

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: I want more life, fucker.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Come here.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: The facts of life.  I'll be blunt. To make an alteration in the evolvement of an organic life system, at least by men, makers or not, it fatal.  A coding sequence can't be revised once it's established.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Because by the second day of incubation any cells that have undergone reversion mutation give rise to revertant colonies -- like rats leaving a sinking ship.  The ship sinks.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: What about E.M.S. recombination?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: We've already tried it -- ethyl methane sulfonate is an alkylating agent and a potent mutagen -- it creates a virus so lethal the subject was destroyed before we left the table.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Then a repressor protein that blocks the operating cells.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Wouldn't obstruct replication, but it does give rise to an error in replication, so that the newly formed DNA strand carries a mutation and you're got a virus again... but all this is academic -- you are made as good as we could make you.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: But not to last.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Put it this way.  Rolls Royces are made to last -- as least they were. But I'm afraid you're a Ferrari. A high strung racing car -- built to win, not to last.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Also you're too valuable to experiment with.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: I am?

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: I've done some questionable things.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Also extraordinary things.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Nothing the God of biomechanics wouldn't let you in heaven for.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: I like a man who stays put.  An admirable thing to be able to sustain yourself in these times. You live here all by yourself, do you?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Well, no, not really.  There's Mr. Deetchum, he's the watchman, he lives on the first floor.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: How about breakfast, I was just going to make some.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: If it wouldn't be too much of a bother... a little bite to eat would be...

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Oh, no bother, I'd be glad to.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Well, actually

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Why are you staring at us?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You're just all so... so different.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: What, Sebastian?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You're androids.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: What generation are you?

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Nexus - 6.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Show me something?

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Like...

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: We have a lot in common.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You mean that you can't come here and I can't go there?

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Not only that, but we have smiliar problems.  Accelerated decrepitude. But we don't want to die quite yet.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Of course not.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: You could help us.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I don't know much about biomechanics, Roy.  I wish I did, but you're out of my league.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: If we don't find help soon, Pris hasn't got long to live.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: What about your friend, the man who owns this building?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Dr. Tyrell?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: He's not really my friend.  I just do a job for him now and then.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Tyrell could help us, Sebastian.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: He could?

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: His company made us.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I'd be happy to mention it to him.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Be better if I could talk to him in person.  But he's not an easy man to get to.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: When do you deliver your project?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: This afternoon.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: You're our best and only friend.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Where are you going, Sebastian?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Just thought I'd...

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: No, you stay here with us.  Out last night together.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: What's going on down there?

turns.speaker: PRIS
turns.text: He's not ready yet.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: PRIS
turns.text: Tomorrow, he says.

turns.speaker: PRIS
turns.text: This is my Uncle Roy, Sebastian.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Hello, glad to meet you.

turns.speaker: PRIS
turns.text: Then we're stupid and we'll die.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Not if everybody is doing their job here at home.  How are things at home?

turns.speaker: PRIS
turns.text: I think, therefore I am.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Very good, Pris.  Now show him why.

turns.speaker: PRIS
turns.text: I want to do it.

turns.speaker: BATTY
turns.text: Okay, but don't kill him.  Save a little for everybody.  A masterpiece.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Six, huh?

turns.speaker: BRYANT
turns.text: Five.  Three nights ago one of them managed to break into the Tyrell Corporation.  Killed two guards and got as far as the Genetic Sector before he got fried going through an electro- field.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: What was he after?

turns.speaker: BRYANT
turns.text: There wasn't much left of him, so we can't be sure.  But bio- chemical data and morphology records of the Nexus-6 were reported missing.  Going on the possibility they might try to infiltrate we send Holden in to run Voight-Kampff tests on the new employees.  Guess he found himself one.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: You got a machine on it yet?

turns.speaker: BRYANT
turns.text: We're using Esper -- a 231 -- that picked up Holden's alarm.  Its guess is that all five are in the city.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Where do we start?

turns.speaker: BRYANT
turns.text: The Tyrell Corporation has a demo model.  Check it out on the Voight-Kampff.  There's a chance the Nexus-6 is beyond out ability to detect.  If that's the case, everybody's up shit creek.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: What was the cover on the one that got Holden?

turns.speaker: BRYANT
turns.text: Industrial refuse.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Garbage man?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BRYANT
turns.text: Bryant here.  Regarding the rundown you requested on job applicants, Esper's concluded that the only irregular category that Tyrell's got is the entertainment section.  You better get on it.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I was just about to have my dinner.

turns.speaker: BRYANT
turns.text: If you hurry you'll get back before it gets cold.  I got a spinner on your roof in five minutes.  Good luck.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: She was gonna get away.

turns.speaker: BRYANT
turns.text: Then let her get away.  I thought you were a pro -- you're supposed to be a fuckin' tracker!

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I didn't like her.

turns.speaker: BRYANT
turns.text: You didn't like her!?

turns.speaker: BRYANT
turns.text: Look, go home.  Get some rest. Take an aspirin.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BRYANT
turns.text: This is Bryant.  Are you alone?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BRYANT
turns.text: She's not with you?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Who.

turns.speaker: BRYANT
turns.text: Take a number.  Canapt 1700, tenth floor, Villa Vita District, Olympia South.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: BRYANT
turns.text: Okay, here it is.  Eldon Tyrell, his family and half his staff were just massacred.  The cat is about to get out of the bag.  Pressure is definitely on.  The Nexus program is terminated.  When you finish there, locate Nexus designated Rachael and retire.

turns.speaker: BRYANT
turns.text: If you don't, we will.  It has to be total, Deckard.  That's an order from as high as it comes.  Got it?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Yeah.  I got it.

turns.speaker: BRYANT
turns.text: Go.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: It's gotta be right for my customer.

turns.speaker: CHEW
turns.text: Your customer, eh?

turns.speaker: CHEW
turns.text: Well, when do you get paid?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Soon as I finish the job.

turns.speaker: CHEW
turns.text: When might that be?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Day after tomorrow.

turns.speaker: CHEW
turns.text: Oh!  Day after tomorrow.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Machines can be helpful sometimes, but they can also be a pain in the ass.  Ask for a trace on a forger and you might wind up at a steel- mill.  I don't mind a bum-steer once in a while -- it's their personalities that usually get me.  Somebody once said that man makes machines in his own image.  If that's true, whoever made Esper should have been shot.

turns.speaker: ESPER
turns.text: This is Esper and I'm ready.  Go ahead please.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: You equipped for random questions?

turns.speaker: ESPER
turns.text: Why, yes, of course.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: You start.

turns.speaker: ESPER
turns.text: The five in question are third generation Nexus Sixes, constructed of skin-flesh culture, selected enogenic transfer conversion capable of self-perpetuating thought, para-physical abilities and developed for emigration program.  Are you with me?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: How do I stop one?

turns.speaker: ESPER
turns.text: Unlike a five, they can sustain massive traumas to several parts of the body without debilitating another.  Sever a leg and it will perform quicker on the remaining leg than the fastest man can run,

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Okay, but...

turns.speaker: ESPER
turns.text: I'm coming to that.  Vulnerable zone is the base of the skull, the occipital bone.  A direct hit is a positive retirement.

turns.speaker: ESPER
turns.text: Here's something you might find interesting.  They have been built to emulate the human in every way except in its emotional spectrum. However, after a period of time it is only logical that such a 'mechanism' would create its own emotional responses, hate, love, fear, anger, envy.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I know all that.

turns.speaker: ESPER
turns.text: What about a summary then.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I think we're through for the night.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: ESPER
turns.text: Do you have something against science?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Not if it works.

turns.speaker: ESPER
turns.text: And what in your estimation works?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: The umbrella.

turns.speaker: ESPER
turns.text: Four years.  Which would make her termination date...

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Never mind.  Do they have that knowledge?

turns.speaker: ESPER
turns.text: Longevity is classified.  No.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Okay, gimme a run-down on the three females.

turns.speaker: ESPER
turns.text: Nexus designated Mary:  incept November 1 2017, domestic conditioning non competitive, trained for day care position.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Next.

turns.speaker: ESPER
turns.text: Nexus designated Pris:  incept data December 13 2017, competitive, programmed to provide pleasure for long term spacers.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Number three.

turns.speaker: ESPER
turns.text: Nexus designated Zhora:  incept June 13th 2017, athletic conditioning, highly competitive, special abilities in the entertainment field.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I think I have no money.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: It's okay.  Forget it.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: But I would like to buy you drink.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I'll but you one.  What'll you have?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Vodka!

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Shot of vodka, please.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Thank you very much.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: My pleasure.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Prosit.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Prosit.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: You want to see my friends?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Sorry, don't have the time.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Those cockroaches?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Ya.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: How long you had these guys?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Two months.  But this one is not guy.  It is girl.  His girl.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Prosit.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Prosit.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: You like to kiss her goodbye.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I like you.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I like you too.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: One more, eh?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I gotta piss.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: How old am I?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: My birthday is April 10, 2015. How long do I live?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Four years.

turns.speaker: HOLDEN
turns.text: I'm great.  I mean, I know I'm not really great, but I feel just great.  How you like my new suit?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Well, you don't have to worry about getting it wrinkled.

turns.speaker: HOLDEN
turns.text: Don't make me laugh.  It makes me pee.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: HOLDEN
turns.text: Hey, it's okay.  I like to pee. So how are you doing?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I'm doing okay.

turns.speaker: HOLDEN
turns.text: From what I hear you're doing great.  Bryant tells me you're going like a god damn one-man army.  Making a lot of money, huh?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Yeah.  But that's what I wanted to talk to you about.

turns.speaker: HOLDEN
turns.text: Money?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: No.  I got a problem.

turns.speaker: HOLDEN
turns.text: Let's hear it.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I think I'm starting to empathize with these Nexus-sixes.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: HOLDEN
turns.text: I'm taking a piss.

turns.speaker: HOLDEN
turns.text: Love is just another name for sex. Love is sexy and sex is lovely -- I don't care what you call it, an android can't have it.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: These aren't just...

turns.speaker: HOLDEN
turns.text: I know what they are, Deck -- Look, maybe they can pretend to feel, but far as the raw, hot emotions of the old heart -- no way.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Nerves of steel.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: No rust?

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: I didn't say that.  Your motivity rate checked out a little slower than last time.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Meaning?

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Meaning you don't run as fast as you used to.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: During the road test...

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Your mind kept wandering.  That bothered me.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Huh huh.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Considering the nature of your work, that could be unhealthy.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: True.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: But you haven't put in for emigration.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: You're going to be over the limit.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Listen, I could make you a long list of complaints about this fucken city but I still rather be here than up there.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: What if you change your mind?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: They'll change the limit before I change my mind.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Never been more sure of anything in my life.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Why didn't you go?

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Too old.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: But if you could?

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: My job is here.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Taffey Lewis?

turns.speaker: TAFFEY
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Can I come in?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I'd like  you to take a look at these pictures.

turns.speaker: TAFFEY
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: TAFFEY
turns.text: You see I lost my contacts a couple of days ago around here somewhere and my sight is a little... What am I supposed to be looking for?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Do you recognize any of them?

turns.speaker: TAFFEY
turns.text: This one looks familiar, but I don't know.  Naw.  There's one came in today looks a little like this one but...

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: What did she want?

turns.speaker: TAFFEY
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: The girl that doesn't look like that girl.

turns.speaker: TAFFEY
turns.text: Nothing.  She wanted to know about suck night.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: What night?

turns.speaker: TAFFEY
turns.text: I didn't know if I wanted to handle her -- I already got a snake act.  But my partner goes down there to the Opera House on suck night to book the good ones.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: What's suck night?

turns.speaker: TAFFEY
turns.text: That's what we call in the trade, audition free-for- alls and most of it sucks. Bit I don't think that's her.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: You talking about the Opera House on the Main?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Book the good ones for where?

turns.speaker: TAFFEY
turns.text: Lots of places.  The tours, the clubs, the Silicone shows, private parties.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: What shows?

turns.speaker: TAFFEY
turns.text: Silicone Valley.  Lots of these science guys never leave that place.  We book two shows a month in there. Those big time techs and bio- guys might be real high zoners up here, but when it comes to the arts, they like it loud and lewd.

turns.speaker: SALOME
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I'm with the American Federation of Variety Artists...

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: There's been reports of management sexually abusing the artists in this place.

turns.speaker: SALOME
turns.text: I don't know nothing about it.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: You haven't felt yourself to be exploited by the management in any way?

turns.speaker: SALOME
turns.text: How do you mean 'exploited'?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Like to get this position.  Did you or were you asked to do anything lewd or unsavory or otherwise repulsive to your person?

turns.speaker: SALOME
turns.text: Are you for real?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Oh, yeah. You'd be surprised what goes on around here.  I'd like to check the dressing room if I could.

turns.speaker: SALOME
turns.text: What the fuck for?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: For holes.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: It that mother real?

turns.speaker: SALOME
turns.text: Of course he's not real.  You think I'd be working here if I could afford a real snake?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: It's a good job.

turns.speaker: SALOME
turns.text: You mean the snake.

turns.speaker: SALOME
turns.text: The best.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Does it eat?

turns.speaker: SALOME
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: SALOME
turns.text: Jeezus!

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: SALOME
turns.text: Hey!  Do your job but don't wreck mine, huh?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: You'd be surprised what a guy'll go through to get a glimpse of a beautiful body.

turns.speaker: SALOME
turns.text: I bet I would.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Little dirty holes the bastards drill in the wall so they can watch a lady undress.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Me.

turns.speaker: SALOME
turns.text: And who do I go to about you?
